input: Title: The Date. Sentence 1: Connie and Bill went on a date. Sentence 2: They agreed to go to dinner and a movie. Sentence 3: Bill took Connie to a nice little diner in town. Sentence 4: After dinner, they went saw a comedy. Choices: a. Bill politely dropped Connie off at home. b. The couple ate and drank and enjoyed themselves.

Title: Church. Sentence 1: Lydia went to church and prayed in front of the altar. Sentence 2: A priest came in and sat beside her. Sentence 3: He asked if she had been there before. Sentence 4: She said many years ago. Choices: a. He then told her to leave because only churchgoers could come inside. b. So when her friends pulled a new prank on her, she stood still.

Title: Hamilton. Sentence 1: Hamilton snored when I slept with him. Sentence 2: He curled up next to me whenever I stayed at my friend's house. Sentence 3: He snored in my ear and got snot on me. Sentence 4: He cuddled close, wanting lots of attention. Choices: a. He always tried to keep me from getting up the next morning. b. He gave Tony a ball and told him to practice every day.

Title: Fence. Sentence 1: The man was building a fence. Sentence 2: The neighbor wanted to help. Sentence 3: The man gave the neighbor some tools. Sentence 4: The neighbor was not much help. Choices: a. The neighbor ruined one of the tools. b. She pulled out her phone and looked up directions herself.

Title: Birthday fun. Sentence 1: Allie had a birthday. Sentence 2: She took them to the casino. Sentence 3: When they got there they had some fun. Sentence 4: Her friend won something. Choices: a. It was a productive day. b. He said he would fix my tooth.

Title: Old Piano. Sentence 1: Fred found an old piano in his attic. Sentence 2: And he remembered he used to play it as a kid. Sentence 3: He had the piano restored. Sentence 4: And it was good enough to play again. Choices: a. But he felt sad as it wasn't the same. b. Corey participated in building a home with Habitat for Humanity.

Title: New ipod. Sentence 1: Susie wanted a new ipod. Sentence 2: She did not have a phone so she didn't have portable music. Sentence 3: Finally her mom got her an ipod for her birthday. Sentence 4: Susie was so happy. Choices: a. She gave her mother a great gift in return. b. Allie was very thrilled.

Title: Deck. Sentence 1: The deck was completely clean. Sentence 2: We had been getting close to finished. Sentence 3: It was my turn. Sentence 4: My grandfather worked on it too. Choices: a. It was a satisfying night. b. It was time to pressure wash the deck.

Title: Birthday Surprise. Sentence 1: John told everyone that he did not want a party for his birthday. Sentence 2: All of his friends promised that they would not throw a party. Sentence 3: On his birthday John was invited to his favorite restaurant. Sentence 4: He kept expecting all of his friends to yell surprise. Choices: a. John was sad when he realized that no one would throw him a party. b. This time, Tom completed his letter and mailed it out.

Title: First Day in the Kitchen. Sentence 1: Sally took out several ingredients. Sentence 2: Since it's her first time cooking, she was a little hesitant. Sentence 3: She ended up placing too much frying oil in the pan. Sentence 4: It splashed everywhere once it became hot. Choices: a. Sally's mom tried cleaning up the mess. b. I cannot eat anything for 3 hours until the filling is settled.

Title: Beach Trip. Sentence 1: Sam had never been to the beach. Sentence 2: He was dying of cancer. Sentence 3: He wanted to go before he died. Sentence 4: His friends wanted to take him. Choices: a. Unfortunately they couldn't afford it. b. She became very ill at the exposure to the contents.

Title: Cape Cod. Sentence 1: In 1983 we drove to Cape Cod. Sentence 2: We went to Hyannis and the beach for a few days. Sentence 3: Then we decided to go to Provincetown. Sentence 4: We drove to Provincetown and shopped. Choices: a. It was an ok vacation. b. I had a fun time selling off the books.

Title: Drunk Driver. Sentence 1: Tim was driving home from work. Sentence 2: He stayed late to make more money. Sentence 3: At night another car crashed into him. Sentence 4: The other driver was drunk and survived. Choices: a. Tim was killed on impact. b. He immediately started saving up money to move away. \

Title: Babysitting. Sentence 1: I was babysitting a 2 year-old for a friend earlier today. Sentence 2: I had to use the bathroom really badly. Sentence 3: The toilet had a childproof lock on it that I couldn't work. Sentence 4: I ended up peeing myself fiddling with it. Choices: a. The kid I was babysitting yelled at me for peeing my pants. b. She now has the strongest Pokemon.

Title: Subway trip. Sentence 1: I had to take the subway to the city. Sentence 2: I usually drive when I need to go to the city. Sentence 3: This day there was too much traffic. Sentence 4: I figured I could get there quicker with the subway. Choices: a. It was an easy ride. b. It is a good compromise, I feel.
